One explanation for how # cryptonetworks evolve like organisms. https://twitter.com/patricknmahoney/status/988124183015165952 …
9/ And so, haters engaging in schadenfreude over crypto boom-busts is really kinda masochistic, as it only makes # cryptoland stronger

8/ Being more fit, and more able to evolve, # cryptonetworks have a better chance of survival in the centuries to come. They will continue to take share in terms of the amount of "human & machine work" expended on the planet.
7/ Over time, the digital economy of resilient # cryptonetworks will be more hardened than their analog counterparts with superior evolutionary mechanisms.
6/ But don't confuse me for saying all cryptonetworks are quality. The majority are not, and will thus be broken (or fade into obsolescence) by boom-busts over time.
5/ The boom-bust cycles then make quality # cryptonetworks stronger by providing *more cycles of learning.*
4/ If constructed with care, and including governance that can incorporate learnings, quality # cryptonetworks become increasingly antifragile with time.
3/ Whether as a technology or a social structure, # cryptonetworks that persist through crypto cycles grow stronger, incorporating their learnings through the boom-busts.

2/ # Cryptoeconomies can be studied through the lens of technology (think S-curves), and also, as the economy of a nation-state specializing in a select number of goods & services, with its own constitution, monetary policy, constituents, etc.
1/ Engaging in schadenfreude over # crypto's boom-bust cycles fails to recognize these cycles represent rapid innovations, capital injections & accelerated learnings for digital economies.
